dict.string: 1 preheat oven to 425, have cast iron pan in there (or oven safe dish) 2 Slice avocado in half, take out pit (not too soft but not too firm either.) 3 take pan out, put avocado half on, crack egg in 4 put whatever you want on top 5 place in oven and cook till your eggs are done how you desire

- 3 avacados, peeled, seeded, mashed - 1 cup salsa - 1/2 cup cottage cheese - Combine all ingredients and 1/4 teaspoon salt,
Mix well. Refrigerate until serving.

- 1 slice avocado - 2 slices whole wheat bread (toasted or untoasted slices whatever you fancy) - 1 lime juice(optional) - 1 pinch salt (optional)
1 Smash avocado on a plate with a fork. 2 Spread between two pieces of bread. 3 Serve. 4 Omit the bread and the paste alone makes a good first baby food. 5 If I'm packing this for lunch sometimes I'll rub the avocado with a cut lime before making the paste. 6 For the adults we add a pinch of salt. Baby/toddler - no salt.

- 8 egg whites - 4 egg yolks - 1/4 cup chicken broth (or vegetable broth) - 1/4 teaspoon salt (plus a pinch to sprinkle on top) - 1/4 teaspoon black pepper - 1 avocado, diced (optional)
1 Separate eggs. 2 Add egg whites and 4 yolks in bowl. 3 Reserve remaining 4 yolks for an alternate use or discard. 4 Add the other three ingredients and wisk together thoroughly. 5 Cook over medium-high heat stirring constantly until eggs are done. 6 Sprinkle with salt and diced avocado. 7 Serve with toast.

1 Slice tomatoes in half. 2 Slice top 1/2 inch off of garlic to expose cloves. Arrange garlic and tomatoes (cut side up) on foil-lined baking dish. Drizzle olive oil over garlic. (This will keep garlic from drying out and getting bitter.) Sprinkle with salt and pepper. 2 Roast in 350 degree oven for 50-60 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for easier handling. 3 Pour juice out of tomatoes. Discard juice. Squeeze tomato pulp and roasted garlic into blender or food processor. 4 Dice tomato skins and garlic paper. Blend or process for 5-10 seconds to obtain a smooth consistency.

- 1 large tart apple, cored and sliced 1/2-inch thick - 2 tablespoons butter or margarine - 1/4 cup packed brown sugar
In a skillet, cook apples in butter until tender. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Cook until apples are golden brown and caramelized, about 5 minutes

- 4 slices whole wheat bread, cubed - 1/2 tablespoon italian seasoning
1 Cut bread into cubes, place on cookie sheet in 250 degree oven. Bake for approximately 15-20 minutes, or until bread is browned and hard. 2 Remove from oven, place bread crumbs and Italian seasoning in blender and mix until well blended and resembling a bread crumb consistency.

- 2 slices white bread - 2 slices American cheese
1.Toast bread in a toaster until golden. Place slices of cheese between the two pieces of toast. 2.Wrap sandwich in a paper towel, and heat in the microwave for 15 to 20 seconds, or until cheese is melted

- 4 tablespoons butter - 1 clove garlic, minced - 3 (3/4 inch thick) slices French bread, cut into cubes
1.Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 2.In a large saute pan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Add bread cubes, and toss to coat. Spread on a baking sheet. 3.Bake for 15 minutes, or until crisp and dry. Check frequently to prevent burning. Cool.

- 3 avacados, peeled, seeded, mashed - 1 cup salsa - 1/2 cup cottage cheese - Combine all ingredients and 1/4 teaspoon salt,
Mix well. Refrigerate until serving.

1 You will also need: Jelly, a drinking glass or rolling pin Lay bread on a smooth counter top and use you drinking glass (or rolling pin) to roll over the bread a few times until the bread is flat and make sure you get the edges or crust too. 2 Spread peanut better and jelly on the flattened bread. 3 Roll bread up like a tortilla

- Sliced Bread - Peanut Butter - 2 Slices of Bacon
Cook Bacon Spread Peanut Butter on Bread Add bacon to PB Sandwich

- 1 slice many grain bread, toasted - 1 1/2 tablespoons peanut butter, we like chunky - 1/2 apple, quartered and sliced (or 1 small apple) salt
Spread peanut butter on toast and top with apple slices, add a sprinkle of salt

- 2 apples - peeled, cored and shredded - 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon - 1/4 cup water - 3 tablespoons brown sugar
1.Place shredded apples in a medium saucepan over medium low heat. Sprinkle with cinnamon, then add water and cook until the apple bits become soft and mushy. 2.Stir in brown sugar and mix well; if desired, top with ice cream and serve

- 1 chicken or mushroom coup can. - 1/4 cup mayonnaise - 3 tablespoons water - 3 teaspoons lemon juice. (Season for taste)
Mix

- 1 can condensed bean with bacon soup, or Chili - 4 corn tortillas - canola oil - 1 teaspoon butter (optional) - 1 tablespoon chopped onion
1 Fry taco shells in a little bit of canola oil, folding to form taco shape. Drain on paper towel. 2 Heat soup (do not add water). If desired, add butter and stir well. 3 Spoon heated bean mixture into taco shells and sprinkle with chopped onion.

- 1 Apple - Peanut Butter - Mini Marshmallows
Cut Apples in identical thin slices. Spread the Peanut Butter on one side of each slices Place some Marshmallows vertically on the Peanut Butter place another slice on top

- Pasta sauce - your favorite - 4 tortillas - 8 oz mozzerella
1 Take soft tortillas and spread with a two spoonfuls of sauce. 2 Add some cheese and toppings. 3 Roll up into cigar shapes rolls and bake at 200 degrees until warm all the way through

- 1 flour tortilla - 2 eggs, scrambled - 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese or swiss cheese or monterey jack cheese
1 Warm tortilla in skillet. 2 Top with scrambled eggs and sprinkle cheese on top. 3 Fold and serve

- 8 oz Beans - 8 oz Corn - 1 oz Mayo
Mix beans, corn, and mayo. Wrap in tortillas and serve immediately. Note: If tortillas are not on hand, a bag of chips will do -- just dip with the chips for a very informal meal!

- 2 flour tortillas - 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 Lay one tortilla on a cookie sheet. 2 Spread cheese over the tortilla, being careful not to spill it out onto the cookie sheet. 3 Cover with second tortilla. 4 Bake at 350 degrees (F) for about 10 minutes, or until tortilla begins to turn golden brown. 5 Cut with a pizza cutter into quarters (or eighths) and serve hot with salsa, sour cream or quacamole.

- Noodles - Tortilla - Tuna
Cook the noodles as you would regularly. Drain all the broth. Arrange in the center of the tortilla and roll. Works best with large tortillas. This is also really good with cheese and tuna. I would suggest melting the cheese onto the tortilla (microwave), then adding the tuna and then the noodles for that.

- Tortillas
Wrap the tortillas in a slightly damp cloth or paper towel and microwave for 30 seconds to steam the tortillas. Coat both sides of the tortillas with cooking spray and drape each tortilla over two bars of your oven rack and bake at 375 degrees Fahrenheit until crispy, which should be 7-10 minutes

- 1 (14 ounce) package corn tortillas - non-fat cooking spray (butter flavored) - popcorn salt
1 Preheat oven to 425 degrees. 2 Lightly spray cookie sheet and set aside. 3 Spray each tortilla shell lightly on each side; sprinkle lightly with popcorn salt. 4 Using kitchen scissors (or knife), cut into one inch wide strips (if using for tortilla soup) or cut into wedges (if using to dip with). 5 Put on cookie sheets in one layer, laying as close to each other as possible without overlapping. 6 Bake at 425 degrees for just a few minutes (3 to 4 minutes watching closely for burning) till they turn a very light brown. 7 Remove and enjoy hot or cold.

- 1/2 can black beans (with juice) - 1/2 cup cheddar cheese, shredded - 2 cups tortilla chips (or as much as you think you can eat)
1 In a microwave safe dish (bowl preferred), place a thin layer of the chips. 2 Add a layer of the black beans and some cheese. 3 Repeat steps 1 and 2 again. 4 Top with extra cheese. 5 Pop in microwave on highest power setting for about a minute and a half. 6 If your microwave doesn't have a rotating plate in it, rotate bowl by hand every 45 seconds and increase cooking time to 2.5 minutes. 7 Top with your favorite salsa and sour cream.

- Tortillas
1 Preheat the oven to 375. 2 Sprinkle each tortilla lightly with water and stack them on a plate. 3 Cover the top with another plate turned upside down and microwave the tortillas for 1 minute or until warm. 4 Turn two 12 cup muffin pans upside down. Mist each side of a tortilla lightly with cooking spray and center it in the space between 4 muffin cups, creating a bowl. Repeat with the 5 remaining tortillas, forming 3 bowls on each tin (as pictured above). 5 Bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes.

- 2 quarts beef stock - 1 cup diced cooked beef - 1 (12 ounce) package barley - ground black pepper to taste
1 In a large stock pot bring beef stock to a gentle boil. Add beef and barley, reduce to simmer, cover and cook at least 1 hour. 2 Check the barley, as to how soft it is. You made need to add more beef stock if to much evaporates. 3 Add ground pepper to taste. Cook until soup reaches desired thickness.

- 4 -5 lbs filet of beef, trimmed and tied - 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature - 1 tablespoon kosher salt - 1 tablespoon fresh coarse ground black pepper
1 Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F. 2 Place the beef on a sheet pan and pat the outside dry with a paper towel. 3 Spread the butter on with your hands. 4 Sprinkle evenly with the salt and pepper. 5 Roast in the oven for exactly 22 minutes for rare and 25 minutes for medium-rare. 6 Remove the beef from the oven, cover it tightly with aluminum foil, and allow it to rest at room temperature for 20 minutes. 7 Remove the strings and slice the fillet thickly. Be sure your oven is very clean or the high temperature will cause it to smoke.

- 5-8 onions - 1 beef bouillon cube, per onion plus 2 - 1 cup water, for every onion used - 4-5 tablespoons butter - pepper
1 Slice Onions into thin rings. 2 Saute Onion in Butter until they are clear. 3 add water and bouillon. 4 Bring to a boil. 5 Turn down heat, simmer for 1 hour

- 2 quarts beef stock - 1 cup diced cooked beef - 1 (12 ounce) package barley - ground black pepper to taste
1 In a large stock pot bring beef stock to a gentle boil. Add beef and barley, reduce to simmer, cover and cook at least 1 hour. 2 Check the barley, as to how soft it is. You made need to add more beef stock if to much evaporates. 3 Add ground pepper to taste. Cook until soup reaches desired thickness.

A 12 pack of beer
Well, you have no ingredients except beer so really your only option is to get drunk. (must be over 21!!)

- 4 ears corn - 2 (12 ounce) cans beer
1 Shuck corn, removing husks and silks. 2 Wash Corn. 3 Place corn in a dish and pour beer over to cover (may also use a large baggie) Set in fridge for at least 6-8 hours, overnight is best. 4 Drain corn and place on a hot grill, turning frequently till done, about 5 minutes. 5 If you would rather do this in a smoker, Preheat smoker to 250°F. 6 Place corn on racks, and stack racks in smoker. 7 Cook for 1 to 2 hours, turning every 20 minutes or so. 8 Either way, kernels should give easily under pressure when done

- 1/2 cup sugar - 1 (12 ounce) can beer - 2 lbs of all-beef hot dogs
1 Cut hot dogs into small pieces. 2 Simmer in beer and sugar uncovered 30 minutes. 3 Have toothpicks close by for spearing.

- 3/4 lb fish (I like Cod), skin on, bone still in - 1 (355 ml) can lager beer, apprx 1 1/3 cups or water - 1 cup water - 3 tablespoons butter - salt and pepper
1 Place the fish, skin side down in it top part of the steamer Steamer pot (like a double boiler but with an insert with holes to allow the steam to come through or a Chinese steamer basket). 2 Pour Beer/water into the bottom half. 3 Bring to a boil and steam the fish until it flakes apprx 20 minutes depending on the thickness of the filet. 4 When coked remove the skin and bones. 5 Lightly butter the flaked fish. 6 Add salt and Pepper.

- 1 cup Italian dressing - 1 (12 ounce) can beer - 2 tablespoons fresh minced garlic - 1 teaspoon black pepper - Chicken pieces
1 Mix together all ingredients. 2 Pour over chicken pieces, toss to coat. 3 Refrigerate for at least 8 hours. 4 Grill or bake chicken as desired (for boneless and skinless chicken breasts grill for about 4-5 minutes each side).

- 1 cup ketchup - 1 cup dark brown sugar - 1 cup beer
In a medium saucepan over low heat, mix the ketchup, dark brown sugar and beer. Heat for approximately 10 minutes.

- 3 jalapenos, sliced - 3 cloves garlic, sliced - 2 cans chopped tomatoes - salt and pepper
1 Slice the garlic and the jalapenos and toss them into the blender, blend until chopped fine. 2 Add cans of tomatoes, with juice, pulse until blended. 3 Serve with sour cream and tortilla chips

- 3 cups oats - Just enough milk or water to make it moist - 3 tablespoons oil - Brown sugar to taste
1 Pour oats in a large bowl. 2 Stir in milk (water if you want even less calories. I find they taste the same) 3 Add oil and brown sugar. 4 Scoop mixture onto a greased baking sheet. 5 Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.

- 4 cups water - 2 cups uncooked white rice - 2 cubes chicken bouillon
1 In a saucepan bring water to a boil. 2 Add rice and bouillon and stir. 3 Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. 4 Mix well before serving.

- 1 cup rice - 1 to taste salt - 2 cups water - 1 to taste butter
1 Rub your slow cooker lightly with 1 tablespoon butter or margarine. 2 Pour in rice, water and salt. 3 Cover and cook on High 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally. Note: Up to 4 cups raw rice may be prepared in slow cooker making 10 cups cooked

- 1/2 cup long grain rice - 1 cup chunky salsa - 1 cup water
1 Mix rice, salsa (I like medium heat, but go with your family's preference) and water in small saucepan. 2 Bring to a boil, cover with lid and reduce heat to low. 3 Simmer, stirring every 5-7 minutes until rice is tender, about 20-25 minutes.

- 1 cup long grain rice - 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup water, to equal 2 cups - 1 tablespoon curry powder
1 Pour undiluted soup into a measuring cup (mine came out to be just under 1 cup) add water to the soup to make 2 cups. 2 Pour onto rice. 3 Add curry powder; mix. 4 Cook according to rice package instructions. Add more water if needed.

- 4 cups whole wheat flour - 1 teaspoon salt - 1/4 teaspoon baking powder - 1 cup warm water
1 In a large bowl, stir together flour, salt and baking powder. Pour in water; stir to combine. Mix in additional water in 1 tablespoon increments, until a soft pliable dough is formed. 2 Knead briefly on a lightly floured surface. Divide dough into 16 equal pieces. Cover and let rest for 20 minutes. 3 Flour each ball well, place between two pieces of wax paper and roll out to desired size and thickness. 4 Heat an ungreased skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Peel away wax paper and grill rounds until brown flecks appear underneath. Turn and cook other side. Serve warm or cool and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer

- 2 cups of all purpose flour - 1 tablespoon of double acting baking powder - 1/2 teaspoon of salt - 1 1/2 cup of coarsely grated extra sharp Cheddar cheese, about 6 ounces - 1 1/2 cup of heavy cream
Into a bowl sift together the flour, baking powder and salt, add the Cheddar cheese, and combine the mixture well. Add the cream and stir the mixture until it just forms a dough. Gather the dough into a ball, knead it gently 6 times on a lightly floured surface, and roll it or pat it out 1/2" thick. Cut out as many rounds as possible with a 2 1/2" round cutter dipped in flour and transfer them to an ungreased baking sheet. Gather the scraps, re-roll the dough, and cut out more rounds in the same manner. Bake the biscuits in the middle of a preheated 425ÂºF. oven for 15 - 17 minutes, or until they are golden. Transfer them to a rack, and let them cool for 5 minutes. Makes about 12 biscuits.

- 4 cups all-purpose flour - 5 eggs - 1 teaspoon salt - 3/4 cup water
1 In large bowl, combine flour, eggs and salt. Add water a little at a time to form a soft dough. 2 Boil 2 quarts of water in a large pot. Squeeze dough out into the water using noodle or fruit press or by pressing through a colander with large holes. When noodles float to the top of the water, they are done (3 to 4 minutes). Serve as a side or main dish.

- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened - 2/3 cup butter, softened - 1 1/3 cup self-rising flour - Butter, softened or melted, for finishing
1 Pulse together the cream cheese, 2/3 cup butter, and 1 cup of flour two or three times in food processor fitted with the knife or dough blade until it comes together in a ball. Turn the dough out onto waxed paper and divide into two rounds. Flatten. Wrap in waxed paper, plastic wrap, or resealable plastic bag, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
2 When ready to bake, preheat oven to 425 degrees.
3 Lightly sprinkle a board or other clean surface using some of the 1/3 cup reserved flour. Sprinkle the top lightly with flour. With floured hands and a floured rolling pin, roll out one portion of the dough at a time to about 1/4 inch thick. Fold the dough over to make it 1/2 inch thick. For each biscuit, dip a 1 to 1 1/4 inch biscuit cutter into reserved flour and cut out the biscuits, starting at the outside edge and cutting very close together, being careful not to twist the cutter. The scraps may be combined to make additional biscuits, although these scraps make tougher biscuits. Roll out the second portion when ready to bake.
4 Using a metal spatula if necessary, move the biscuits to an ungreased baking sheet, placing the biscuits 1 inch apart. Refrigerate the biscuits for 10 to 20 minutes until cold. Bake the biscuits on the top rack of the oven for a total of 10 to 12 minutes until light golden brown. After 6 minutes, rotate the pan in the oven so that the front of the pan is now turned to the back, and check to see if the bottoms are browning too quickly. If so, slide another packing pan underneath to add insulation and retard the browning. Continue baking another 4 to 6 minutes until the biscuits are light golden brown. When the biscuits are done, lightly brush the tops with butter. Turn the biscuits out upside down on a plate to cool slightly. Serve hot, right side up.
5 These biscuits may be frozen, unbaked or baked, and reheated.

- 5-8 onions - 1 beef bouillon cube, per onion plus 2 - 1 cup water, for every onion used - 4-5 tablespoons butter - pepper
1 Slice Onions into thin rings. 2 Saute Onion in Butter until they are clear. 3 add water and bouillon. 4 Bring to a boil. 5 Turn down heat, simmer for 1 hour
Mix all together and spread on bread!

- 1 (6 ounce) can canned tuna - 1 egg - 3 slices bread, torn into peices
1 Combine all ingredients. 2 Form patties. 3 Panfry in butter on medium heat.

- 1 (6 ounce) can chunk light tuna in water, drained - 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened - 3 tablespoons salsa
1.In a small bowl, blend the tuna, cream cheese and salsa. Serve immediately.

- 1 cup mustard powder - 1/2 cup vinegar - 2/3 cup sugar - 1/2 cup water - 1 pinch salt
1 Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan. 2 Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. 3 Place in sterilized jar and refrigerate.

- 3 large ripe tomatoes - 1 pint cherry tomatoes - 1/2 package feta cheese - 2 tablespoons olive oil - 1 pinch ground pepper - 1 pinch salt
1 Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl. 2 Chill for 1 hour.

- 3-5 medium potatoes - 1/2 teaspoon salt - 1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 The number of potatoes simply depends upon the number of people you are feeding. 2 Wash and do not peel the potatoes. Microwave on high until mostly done. If using 2-3 small red potatoes for two servings this will be about 2 1/2 minutes. 3 While microwaving the potatoes fill a bowl with iced water. When potatoes are done drop them into the ice water and cut them length wise in half to expedite cooling. 4 When just cool enough to handle quickly shred (inside will probably still be warm so be quick) without peeling them into a frying pan sprayed with Pam or lightly oiled. The peels will remain in your hand after shredding each half, small amount might be seen in the potatoes but not much. 5 If you want to add other items to these then shred them onto a plate first, add the other items and them place in fry pan. You might want to add some diced onion, bacon or bacon bits, shredded cheese, chives or whatever you might imagine.

- 4 tomatoes (vine ripened is best) - 2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil - 1 teaspoon dried basil - 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
1 Cut tomatoes in half. 2 drizzle with a little olive oil. 3 sprinkle with basil. 4 grind pepper over the top. 5 I normally then pop in the fridge a while (say 30 mins) while working on other stuff as it helps the flavour develop. 6 Cook uncut side down for around 5 minutes over low heat on BBQ plate. 7 flip over and cook further 5 minutes with cut side down. 8 return to original position for the last 5 minutes of cooking.

- 4 fingerling potatoes - 4 slices thick cut bacon
1 Preheat the oven to 350. 2 Wrap each potato with a bacon strip and secure at each end with a toothpick. This is really easy to do with a fingeling potato as the long shape is ideal. 3 Place the bacon wrapped potatoes in a roasting dish uncovered. 4 Cook uncovered in the oven for an hour and 15 minutes or until desired crispness of the bacon. Turning over one time (you can remove the toothpicks before turning them) about half way through. 5 Serve.

1.Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 2.Scrub potato skins, and pat dry. Place them in a medium bowl, and pour salad dressing over. Toss to coat. Spread the potato skins out in a thin layer on a baking sheet. 3.Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until crisp and golden.

- 1 baking potato, Unpeeled - 2 tablespoons fat-free Italian salad dressing
1 Preheat oven to 500Â°F. 2 Lightly spray cookie sheet with vegetable cooking spray. 3 Slice unpeeled baking potato into very thin slices. 4 In bowl, toss potato slices with dressing until evenly coated. 5 Arrange potatoes in single layer on cookie sheet. 6 Bake about 20 minute or until lightly browned on both sides, turning once after 10 minute

- 1 lb. lean ground beef - 1 onion, chopped - 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables - 10 oz. can cream of mushroom soup with roasted garlic - 3 cups refrigerated mashed potatoes
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In heavy skillet cook ground beef and onion until beef is brown and onion is tender, stirring to break up meat, about 10 minutes. Drain well. Stir in vegetables and soup and cook until hot, about 4 minutes. Place in 9 inch pie plate. Spoon mashed potatoes over hot meat mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 35-45 minutes until potatoes are golden brown and pie is bubbling. 6 servings

- 4 baking potatoes, peeled and quartered - 1 lemon, juice of - 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
1 Place peeled and quartered baking potatoes in a pan just big enough to hold them in one layer. 2 Place lemon juice in a one-cup measure. 3 Add enough water to make one cup liquid.

- Crackers - Honey - Chicken Breast or Tenderloins
Preheat over to 425. Get a quart bag and crush graham crackers until it is mostly powder (some chunks are OK) Drizzle honey on your washed chicken breasts or tenderloins Put the chicken in the graham crackers and shake until they are covered. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle more of the cracker dust on top and drizzle some more honey if you want. Bake at 425 for 20-25 minutes. Serve with honey bbq sauce or plain! They are sweet, juicy, and tender.

- 32 oz cubed Velveeta cheese - 10 oz. can of rotel - 1 lb. browned ground beef
Melt cheese with rotel. Stir in meat. Serve with corn chips.

- 1/2 pound of ground beef - 2 pkgs. noodles (preffered with seasoning packet) - 4 cups of water
1 Brown ground beef and drain the grease. 2 Add the packages of noodles and the season packet, then add the 4 cups of water. 3 Boil until noodles are tender and the water is absorb.

-1 cup Milk - 1/3 cup of any Fruit or Veggies
Blend it with Fruits or Veggies

- 4 eggs - 3 teaspoons milk - salt and pepper - onion, diced
1 Beat eggs well. 2 Add milk, salt and pepper. 3 Stir in diced onion. 4 Place in microwave save dish and cook on high for 2 minutes. 5 Stop and stir. 6 Cook 1 1/2-2 minutes longer on high.

- pasta, for one - 1/2 head garlic - 4 tablespoons olive oil - 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, freshly ground - 1 pinch salt
1 Cook your pasta in the usual way. 2 The amount depends on how hungry you are. 3 In a small heavy pan (or very carefully in a light one) heat the oil with the garlic the black pepper and the salt. 4 "fry"the garlic until it has gone very slightly golden. 5 Turn off the heat and let it stand until the pasta is cooked. 6 Mix the pasta with the oil and garlic and enjoy.

- 1 (16 ounce) package ziti pasta - 2 (15 ounce) cans mamwich original Manwich sloppy joe mix - 2 cups sharp cheddar cheese, shredded - 1 1/2 lbs ground beef
Cook pasta according to pkg directions. Drain set aside. In lg saucepan cook beef until no longer pink, drain fat. Add cans of mamwich mix well. Spary baking dish with nonstick spary. Pour noodles in baking dish and pour meatsauce over noodles. Mix well to combine. Top with cheese and bake @ 350 for 30 minutes or until cheese melts and its heated through.
